ref: 2309 upāyana n. ʻ approach ʼ RV., ʻ present ʼ MBh. [Semant. cf. *bhēṭṭ -- : √i2]
Pa. upāyana -- n. ʻ going to, present ʼ;
Pk. uvāyaṇa -- , uā˚ n. ʻ visit, present ʼ, vāyaṇa -- n. ʻ offering of food ʼ (→
Sk. vāyana -- n. ʻ pious gifts of sweetmeats &c. ʼ lex.);
H. bāyan, bāenā, bainā m. ʻ sweetmeat or cake distributed at weddings and other festivals ʼ;
G. vāyṇũ n. ʻ dinner given by relative to a wife in her first pregnancy ʼ;
M. vāṇ n. ʻ pious gift of fruit, cakes, clothing, &c. ʼ
